{{cpp/title|system_error}}
{{cpp/error/system_error/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=system_error|since=c++11|
class system_error;
}}

{{tt|std::system_error}} is the type of the exception thrown by various library functions (typically the functions that interface with the OS facilities, e.g. the constructor of {{lc|std::thread}}) when the exception has an associated {{lc|std::error_code}}, which may be reported.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;system_error&gt;
#include &lt;thread&gt;

int main()
{
    try
    {
        std::thread().detach(); // attempt to detach a non-thread
    }
    catch(const std::system_error&amp; e)
    {
        std::cout &lt;&lt; "Caught system_error with code "
                     "[" &lt;&lt; e.code() &lt;&lt; "] meaning "
                     "[" &lt;&lt; e.what() &lt;&lt; "]\n";
    }
}
|p=true
|output=
Caught system_error with code [generic:22] meaning [Invalid argument]
}}
